name: ai-trading-bot
description: Machine learning-powered algorithmic trading system with real-time market analysis
readme:
# AI Trading Bot

A sophisticated machine learning-powered algorithmic trading system designed for real-time market analysis and automated trading decisions.

## Features

- Real-time market data processing
- Multiple ML models (LSTM, Transformer, Random Forest)
- Risk management and portfolio optimization
- Backtesting framework
- Live trading integration with major exchanges

## Installation

```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

## Usage

```python
from ai_trading_bot import TradingBot

bot = TradingBot()
bot.run()
```

## Documentation

Full documentation available at https://digital-ai-finance.github.io/ai-trading-bot

name: risk-analysis-toolkit
description: Comprehensive toolkit for financial risk assessment using AI and statistical methods
readme:
# Risk Analysis Toolkit

A comprehensive Python toolkit for financial risk assessment combining AI techniques with traditional statistical methods.

## Key Features

- Value at Risk (VaR) calculations
- Monte Carlo simulations
- Credit risk modeling
- Market risk analysis
- Stress testing frameworks
- AI-powered anomaly detection

## Quick Start

```python
from risk_toolkit import RiskAnalyzer

analyzer = RiskAnalyzer()
var = analyzer.calculate_var(portfolio, confidence=0.95)
```

name: portfolio-optimizer
description: AI-driven portfolio optimization engine using modern portfolio theory and machine learning
readme:
# Portfolio Optimizer

An advanced AI-driven portfolio optimization engine that combines Modern Portfolio Theory with cutting-edge machine learning techniques.

## Features

- Mean-variance optimization
- Black-Litterman model
- Risk parity strategies
- ML-enhanced return predictions
- Multi-objective optimization
- ESG-aware portfolio construction

## Installation

```bash
pip install portfolio-optimizer
```

## Example

```python
from portfolio_optimizer import Optimizer

optimizer = Optimizer()
weights = optimizer.optimize(returns, risk_free_rate=0.02)
```

name: sentiment-analysis-finance
description: NLP-based sentiment analysis for financial news and social media to predict market movements
readme:
# Sentiment Analysis for Finance

Advanced NLP-based sentiment analysis specifically designed for financial news, earnings calls, and social media to predict market movements.

## Features

- Financial-domain BERT models
- Real-time news scraping
- Twitter sentiment tracking
- Earnings call analysis
- Multi-source sentiment aggregation
- Market impact prediction

## Supported Sources

- Reuters, Bloomberg, WSJ
- Twitter/X financial discussions
- Reddit (r/wallstreetbets, r/investing)
- Company earnings transcripts
- SEC filings (10-K, 10-Q)

## Usage

```python
from sentiment_finance import SentimentAnalyzer

analyzer = SentimentAnalyzer()
sentiment = analyzer.analyze_stock('AAPL')
```

name: crypto-prediction-models
description: Deep learning models for cryptocurrency price prediction and volatility forecasting
readme:
# Crypto Prediction Models

State-of-the-art deep learning models for cryptocurrency price prediction and volatility forecasting.

## Models

- LSTM networks for time series
- Transformer-based architectures
- GRU with attention mechanisms
- Ensemble methods
- Hybrid CNN-LSTM models

## Features

- Multi-crypto support (BTC, ETH, and 100+ altcoins)
- Real-time price feeds
- On-chain data integration
- Social sentiment incorporation
- Volatility predictions
- Risk metrics

## Performance

- Bitcoin: 72% directional accuracy (7-day)
- Ethereum: 68% directional accuracy (7-day)
- Volatility RMSE: 0.15 (normalized)

## Quick Start

```python
from crypto_prediction import CryptoPredictor

predictor = CryptoPredictor('BTC')
forecast = predictor.predict(days=7)
```

name: financial-data-api
description: RESTful API for accessing financial market data, fundamental data, and alternative data sources
readme:
# Financial Data API

A comprehensive RESTful API providing access to financial market data, fundamental data, and alternative data sources.

## Endpoints

- `/api/v1/stocks/{symbol}` - Stock quotes and historical data
- `/api/v1/fundamentals/{symbol}` - Financial statements and ratios
- `/api/v1/news` - Financial news aggregation
- `/api/v1/crypto` - Cryptocurrency data
- `/api/v1/sentiment` - Market sentiment indicators

## Features

- Real-time and historical data
- Rate limiting and authentication
- WebSocket support for streaming
- Comprehensive documentation (OpenAPI)
- Client SDKs (Python, JavaScript, R)

## Quick Start

```bash
curl https://api.digital-ai-finance.com/api/v1/stocks/AAPL
```

## Authentication

API key required. Register at https://digital-ai-finance.com/api-keys

name: quantitative-research
description: Research notebooks and papers on quantitative finance topics and AI applications
readme:
# Quantitative Research

A collection of research notebooks, papers, and implementations exploring quantitative finance topics and AI applications in financial markets.

## Contents

### Research Papers
- Factor investing with machine learning
- Deep reinforcement learning for portfolio management
- Alternative data in alpha generation
- Market microstructure and HFT

### Notebooks
- Factor analysis and backtesting
- Options pricing with neural networks
- Statistical arbitrage strategies
- Risk model development

### Implementations
- Published paper reproductions
- Novel strategy implementations
- Benchmark comparisons

## Citation

If you use this research, please cite:

```
@misc{digital-ai-finance-research,
  author = {Digital AI Finance},
  title = {Quantitative Research Repository},
  year = {2023},
  url = {https://github.com/Digital-AI-Finance/quantitative-research}
}
```

name: backtesting-framework
description: High-performance backtesting framework for trading strategies with realistic market simulation
readme:
# Backtesting Framework

A high-performance, event-driven backtesting framework for trading strategies with realistic market simulation.

## Features

- Event-driven architecture
- Realistic order execution simulation
- Transaction cost modeling
- Slippage and market impact
- Multiple asset classes (stocks, futures, options, crypto)
- Portfolio-level backtesting
- Risk analytics and reporting
- Parallel processing support

## Performance

- Backtest 10 years of daily data: < 2 seconds
- Minute-level data: < 30 seconds
- Supports multi-asset portfolios (1000+ securities)

## Example

```python
from backtesting import Backtest, Strategy

class MyStrategy(Strategy):
    def init(self):
        pass
        
    def next(self):
        if self.data.Close[-1] > self.data.Close[-2]:
            self.buy()

bt = Backtest(data, MyStrategy)
results = bt.run()
bt.plot()
```
